summary: This is an email chain from June 22, 2020, discussing the imminent charging and arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. It reveals internal DOJ/FBI planning, including considerations of timing (moving up from August), extradition (presuming she is outside the U.S.), and follow-up investigative travel after her arrest.

persons.name: SSA Watson
persons.context: Identified as 'FBI New York' and is the primary source providing the update on the plan to charge and arrest Ghislaine Maxwell, including details about a conference call with SDNY to discuss timing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain explicitly states 'We are in the process of charging Maxwell' and discusses plans for her imminent arrest and the logistics of extradition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in a forwarded question from 'The DD' asking 'Jeffery Epstein - Where does this stand? What's left to be done?'

connections.description: The document contextually links Maxwell to the Epstein investigation, as the planning for her arrest is framed within the broader 'Jeffery Epstein' case inquiry.
SSA Watson is the FBI agent providing the operational update on the plan to charge and arrest Maxwell.

events.title: Internal DOJ/FBI Planning Call for Maxwell Arrest
events.description: The email discusses a scheduled conference call with SDNY to discuss moving up the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell from an initial August timeline to 'within the next few weeks'.

events.title: Decision to Charge Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The email states 'We are in the process of charging Maxwell' and confirms the plan to arrest her.

keyFacts: As of June 22, 2020, the U.S. government was actively in the process of charging Ghislaine Maxwell and planning her arrest.
The initial arrest timeline was thought to be August 2020, but a conference call with SDNY was scheduled to discuss moving the arrest up to within a few weeks.
The planners presumed Maxwell was outside the continental United States (OCONUS) and were considering extradition logistics.
The plan included follow-up investigative travel to conduct interviews after her arrest.
The email chain shows high-level internal coordination regarding the Maxwell case, prompted by direct questions from a senior official ('The DD').
